Among the exhibitors, three money lenders. Apparently borrowing for a wedding is quite normal.
@GrowFromHereNZ Yes! Have seen some great articles on 'pink-washing' of girls' products. A colour likewise off-limits for boys; purple too.
Went to a wedding expo today, for a piece I'm writing. *That* was an eye opener. But these things always are.
Which is not to say some girls don't adore fashion & seek a career in design/style - just that I reckon it's far fewer than represented.
I've met few girl children who are innately interested in fashion or clothes design. Yet it is pushed at them 24/7 as a gender norm. 2/2
So many girl-focused cartoons, apps, books etc make a big deal about fashion, characters wanting to be a 'fashionista', etc. 1/2

Many SAHMs would rather not - they hv their hands full already - but there's no other option. They're the default go-to childcare provider.
@PadraigBelton A remarkable person, and much missed. We were so lucky to have her.
NZ friend in UK observes that many part-time jobs there are 9am to 2pm, hours that are much more mum-friendly.
SAHMs providing (often free) care for their friends' kids, usually before and/or after school care, so their friends can do her paid job.
In NZ there's an invisible economy of SAHMs providing childcare for mums in paid work, largely due to un-family-friendly working hours.
@PadraigBelton Lovely obit. What prompted you to write about MF? An assigned piece,or did you already have an interest in her work?
